snippet: New data from the Census Bureau showed that 1.7 million New Yorkers were poor, while the 2012 mean income of the highest-earning 5 percent was $436,931.
abstract: Census Bureau data shows that 1.7 million New Yorkers fall below official federal poverty threshold, while mean income of highest-earning 5 percent in 2012 was $436,931; data lends support to mayoral candidate Bill de Blasio's argument that city's gap between rich and poor remains stubbornly large.
lead_paragraph: New data from the Census Bureau showed that 1.7 million New Yorkers were poor, while the 2012 mean income of the highest-earning 5 percent was $436,931.

headline.main: Poverty Rate Is Up in New York City, and Income Gap Is Wide, Census Data Show
headline.print_headline: Poverty Rate Up in City, and Income Gap Is Wide, Census Data Show
